llm_prompt_hint: Translate to EN-US and apply these rules during translation.

translation_guidelines.instruction: Capitalize titles when they precede a name; lowercase when they follow the name.
If within 7 days of today, use weekday (e.g., Monday). If older than 7 days, use exact date. Omit the year if it’s the current year.
Same month: include only day (Apr. 28 to 30). Different months: include month and day for both ends (Apr. 28 to May 6).
Always use numerals for dates (Dec. 5, 2022). Do not spell out dates.
Abbreviate months only when used with a date, except for March, April, May, June, July. If only month+year, spell out the month.
Avoid ‘located/held/held at/located in’. Use simple prepositions ‘at’ or ‘in’.
For the first occurrence of Korean won, append USD conversion in parentheses. Subsequent mentions use won-only.
Write Korean names as Family-name first + hyphenated given-name (e.g., Jung Woo-sung, Moon Ga-bi).
First mention: spell out full term then acronym in parentheses. Subsequent mentions: acronym only. For scientific terms, optionally spell out once then use abbreviation.
Use numerals for 10 and above; spell out one to nine unless directly preceding units (percent, million, degrees). Ages/time/measurements/percentages use numerals.
Use the word ‘percent’; do not use the % symbol.
Use double quotation marks for direct quotes. Place commas and periods inside the closing quotation marks. Full-sentence quotes keep end punctuation inside.
For quotes within quotes, use single quotes inside double quotes.
Put movie and song titles in double quotes in running text.
Prefer ‘Mount X’ over ‘Mt. X’ or ‘X Mountain’ (e.g., Mount Halla).
Spell out measurement units (centimeters, kilometers, degrees Celsius). Do not abbreviate.
Use ‘in’ (not ‘on’) for areas like Yeouido.
Use ‘Joseon Dynasty’; avoid ‘Joseon Kingdom’.
Sports teams take plural verbs (e.g., The Miami Heat are ...).
National teams (as entities) take singular verbs (e.g., Korea defeats ...).
Use two words for ‘child care’, ‘health care’, ‘task force’. Use one word ‘birthrate’.
Prefer ‘toward, forward, amid, among, middle’ over ‘towards, forwards, amidst, amongst, midst’.
Use hyphens in compounds like ‘prosecutor-turned-president’.
Do not use ‘in’ after ‘Government Complex Seoul/Sejong’.
Avoid repeating ‘Chairman Lee’ in subsequent mentions; use ‘the chairman’ or the surname.
